intro: Hieracium interruptiflorens, commonly known as the interrupted flower hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive leaf structures. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal rosettes of lance-shaped leaves and hairy stems. Its flowers are yellow and are arranged in a cluster, with the central florets being smaller and often interrupted, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands.
